Reading

I'm listing fiction first since it got me into reading. I've been told non-fiction is where the real wisdom is. The way I see it every fiction book is just a colorful visage wrapped around a core of first-hand learnings of the author. Plus, read what you love to But I'll leave it at that. For non-fiction, scroll below. All links are from Amazon (and I've chosen the Kindle versions) and I don't get a cut.

Fiction

The Ultimate Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, by Douglas Adams

For the best combination of wisdom with nonsense and satire with silliness I have seen in a science fiction book.


To Kill a Mockingbirgd, by Harper Lee

For a story of empathy in which a terrible injustice is unfolds before the gentle eyes of a child and her father.


The Fountainhead, by Ayn Rand

For its somewhat controversial philosophy of objectivism but still a wonderful story about the career trajectories of two frenemies and the evolution of their competence.
